decision_conditions: The application exceeds the maximum parking standards and has failed to demonstrate that the proposed car parking spaces would not adversely impact on highway safety and efficient operation of the road, as a result would be detrimental to highway safety contrary to Policies DC32, DC33 and DC61 of the London Borough of Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD Adopted 2008, and the Adopted Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2011 and Policy 6.13 of the London Plan.

The application would result in further car parking at the site which encourages the use of private vehicles contributing to the already high levels of pollution and detrimentally impacting the air quality management area which the site forms part of, contrary to the requirements of Policy DC 52 Air Quality of the London Borough of Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD Adopted 2008.

The proposed parking spaces in the front garden would result in likely noise, general disturbance, light pollution and fumes associated with vehicles manoeuvring directly adjacent to the front windows of the ground floor, be detrimental to the amenity enjoyed by the occupiers contrary to the Residential Extension and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy DC61 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document.

The proposed car parking spaces would result in the loss of the external residential amenity at the property which Is harmful both to residential amenity and to the character and appearance of this part of the streetscene,contrary to Residential Extension and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy DC61 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mrs Jane Green via email on 30/09/20
description: 3 parking spaces to the front of the building facing Billet lane.
